qas.question: Who won the war between the Licchavis and the Kiratas?
Who did the migrating Shakyas pretend to be?
What sect of Buddhism is the only remaining one based in Sanskrit?
Under the Licchavi dynasty, what name was typically used to refer to Yengal?

context: The <a0_0>Licchavis<a0_0/> from the Indo-Gangetic plain migrated north and defeated the Kiratas, establishing the Licchavi dynasty. During this era, following the genocide of Shakyas in Lumbini by <a3_0>Virudhaka<a3_0/>, the survivors migrated north and entered the forest monastery in Sankhu masquerading as <a1_0>Koliyas<a1_0/>. From Sankhu, they migrated to Yambu and Yengal (Lanjagwal and Manjupattan) and established the first permanent Buddhist monasteries of Kathmandu. This created the basis of <a2_0>Newar<a2_0/> Buddhism, which is the only surviving Sanskrit-based Buddhist tradition in the world. With their migration, Yambu was called Koligram and Yengal was called <a4_0>Dakshin Koligram<a4_0/> during most of the Licchavi era.
